channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-19216] CMS: Additional nodes are not added to CMS
item.description:
When creating a 3 node cluster on a local machine using 3 loopback addresses

127.0.0.1
127.0.0.2
127.0.0.3

The nodes are created correctly and the first node is assigned as a CMS node as shown:

bin/nodetool p 7199 status{}
Datacenter: datacenter1=======================Status=Up/Down|/ State=Normal/Leaving/Joining/Moving-  Address    Load       Tokens  Owns (effective)  Host ID                               Rack

UN  127.0.0.3  75.55 KiB  16      76.0%             6d194555-f6eb-41d0-c000-000000000003  rack1

UN  127.0.0.2  67.97 KiB  16      59.3%             6d194555-f6eb-41d0-c000-000000000002  rack1

UN  127.0.0.1  81 KiB     16      64.7%             6d194555-f6eb-41d0-c000-000000000001  rack1

bin/nodetool -p 7199 describecms
Cluster Metadata Service:
Members: /127.0.0.1:7000
Is Member: true
Service State: LOCAL
Is Migrating: false
Epoch: 14
Local Pending Count: 0
Commits Paused: false
Replication factor: ReplicationParams{class=org.apache.cassandra.locator.MetaStrategy, datacenter1=1}

However after doing a reconfigurecms to create a replication factor of 3, it seems that there is still only one member of cms.

bin/nodetool -p 7199 reconfigurecms datacenter1:3
bin/nodetool -p 7199 describecms
Cluster Metadata Service:
Members: /127.0.0.1:7000
Is Member: true
Service State: LOCAL

Is Migrating: false

Epoch: 16

Local Pending Count: 0

Commits Paused: false

Replication factor: ReplicationParams{class=org.apache.cassandra.locator.MetaStrategy, datacenter1=3}

Is this correct, should all 3 nodes be shown in the Members section ?
item.summary: CMS: Additional nodes are not added to CMS

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I'll submit a patch for this later today

as a workaround until then you can use nodetool reconfigureccms datacenter1:3 --sync

Thanks Marcus
I will try this then, and retest the other problems I have 

Just as a side note, I saw this exception in the logs when shutting down the node:

INFO  [StorageServiceShutdownHook] 2023-12-21 10:56:23,718 HintsService.java:235 - Paused hints dispatch
ERROR [NonPeriodicTasks:1] 2023-12-21 10:56:23,730 ReconfigureCMS.java:160 - Could not finish adding the node to the Cluster Metadata Service

e

https://github.com/krummas/cassandra/commits/marcuse/19216/

will post ci results later today

Sorry for taking so long to review. The patch LGTM and as far as I can see, any failures in the CI results appear unrelated. Might be worth rebasing and re-running CI though before commit.
+1 from me if that looks ok.
I ll run CI and eventually take care of the merge.
